plugins.name: E-ImageCompression
plugins.description:
E-ImageCompression is a privacy-focused tool that lets you reduce image sizes by up to 90% without sacrificing quality, seamlessly integrated into your workflow.


Your files are never stored on our servers — images are processed securely via the official TinyPNG API and delivered straight back to you.


Batch compress multiple images, preview results, and export everything with a single click.

Perfect for anyone who values speed, security, and high-quality image optimization.
plugins.tagline: Optimize images in one click

137038.name: E-ImageCompression
137038.description:
E-ImageCompression is a privacy-focused tool that lets you reduce image sizes by up to 90% without sacrificing quality, seamlessly integrated into your workflow.


Your files are never stored on our servers — images are processed securely via the official TinyPNG API and delivered straight back to you.


Batch compress multiple images, preview results, and export everything with a single click.

Perfect for anyone who values speed, security, and high-quality image optimization.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin uses TinyPNG API for image compression. Since TinyPNG API doesn't support CORS directly, we use a CORS proxy (cors.siteceterum.ru) for secure API communication.

plugins.name: Color Palette Extractor
plugins.description:
Easily audit and document your color palette. This plugin scans any selection, extracts all solid colors and gradients, and lists them with their official Variable or Style name.

Get instant access to HEX (with alpha), RGBA and HLS codes, and export the entire list to an HTML file, perfect for creating style guides and improving developer handoff.
plugins.tagline: Extracts colors, codes, and names from your selection. Lets you export the palette to HTML

136609.name: Color Palette Extractor
136609.description:
Easily audit and document your color palette. This plugin scans any selection, extracts all solid colors and gradients, and lists them with their official Variable or Style name.

Get instant access to HEX (with alpha), RGBA and HLS codes, and export the entire list to an HTML file, perfect for creating style guides and improving developer handoff.
136609.tagline: Extracts colors, codes, and names from your selection. Lets you export the palette to HTML

plugins.name: Slide Auto-Numbering by Works.
plugins.description:
Slide Auto-Numbering


This plugin automatically numbers your Figma Slides. Wherever a TEXT layer named “page number” exists, it will be overwritten with the correct slide index (1, 2, 3, …).


How to use:

• Ensure each slide has a TEXT layer named “page number.”

• Run the plugin (Plugins → Development → Slide Auto-Numbering → Run).

• The plugin will number the slides linearly in the order provided by Figma Slides.
plugins.tagline: Auto-number your slides ;)

135716.name: Slide Auto-Numbering by Works.
135716.description:
Slide Auto-Numbering


This plugin automatically numbers your Figma Slides. Wherever a TEXT layer named “page number” exists, it will be overwritten with the correct slide index (1, 2, 3, …).


How to use:

• Ensure each slide has a TEXT layer named “page number.”

• Run the plugin (Plugins → Development → Slide Auto-Numbering → Run).

• The plugin will number the slides linearly in the order provided by Figma Slides.
135716.release_notes: This plugin is for only for Figma Slides, the Figma Design option is removed to avoid confusion.

plugins.name: Brand compliance check
plugins.description:
Branding compliance check Figma Plugin


Purpose

The Branding-compliance-check plugin helps designers ensure that their design elements are consistent with the assets library added to their Figma file. It highlights and marks design elements that are not from the assets library, ensuring branding compliance.


Features

  1. Design Elements Check: Verify if colors, fonts, Non-component frames & effects are from the assets library.
  2. Highlight Issues: Select and bring non-compliant elements to the user's viewport.
  3. Mark Issues: Add a red stroke around non-compliant elements.


Usage guidelines

  1. Select Design Elements: Check the boxes for the design elements you want to verify.
  2. Highlight Issues: Click the "Highlight issues" button to select and bring non-compliant elements to the viewport.
  3. Mark Issues: Click the "Mark issues" button to select and add a red stroke around non-compliant elements.
plugins.tagline: Quick sanity checks for Figma files to verify if design elements of file are brand library aligned

135406.name: Brand compliance check
135406.description:
Branding compliance check Figma Plugin

Features

  2. Highlight Issues: Select and bring non-compliant elements to the user's viewport.
  3. Mark Issues: Add a red stroke around non-compliant elements.


Usage guidelines

135406.tagline: Quick sanity checks for Figma files to verify if design elements of file are brand library aligned

plugins.name: adamantium token lab - analyze, organize & export tokens
plugins.description:
adamantium token lab

Your ultimate Figma Variables exporter & manager to rule your tokens.


Stop manually transcribing design tokens! adamantium token lab bridges the gap between your Figma Variables and your codebase, streamlining your design-to-development workflow with unparalleled power and flexibility.


Whether you're working with a simple project or a complex multi-library design system, adamantium token lab gives you the tools to view, manage, analyze, and export your design tokens exactly how you need them. Say goodbye to errors, inconsistencies, and wasted time.


Why You Need adamantium token lab:

  1. Bridge the Design-Dev Gap: Seamlessly translate your Figma Variables into production-ready code.
  2. Ensure Consistency: Maintain a single source of truth for your design tokens across all projects.
  3. Boost Efficiency: Automate token exports, saving hours and reducing manual errors.
  4. Unmatched Customization: Tailor token output to perfectly match your team's coding standards.
  5. Maintain a Clean Design System: Understand token usage, identify unused variables, and keep your system tidy.
  6. Empower Collaboration: Provide developers with exactly what they need, in their preferred format.
  7. Handle Complexity with Ease: Advanced features like comprehensive library alias resolution simplify managing large-scale design systems.



Core Features:

Token Viewing & Management:

  1. View all Figma Variables (colors, numbers, strings, booleans) in a dynamic, resizable table.
  2. See token names, descriptions, types, and values per mode at a glance.
  3. Toggle in-table alias resolution to see actual values directly.
  4. Customize the display format for color values (HEX, RGBA, HSLA, etc.) in the table.
  5. Easily filter and view tokens from specific collections.


Powerful & Highly Customizable Export Engine:

  1. Export to CSS Custom Properties.
  2. Export to SASS Variables ($var).
  3. Export to SASS Maps (Nested or Flat options available).
  4. Export to JSON (Structured or Nested, with options for flat key paths).
  5. Export a developer-friendly Intermediate Representation (IR) for custom workflows.
  6. Apply naming conventions: camelCase, PascalCase, kebab-case, snake_case, and more.
  7. Add custom prefixes and suffixes to token names or filenames.
  8. Define custom path separators for token names (e.g., -, _, .).
  9. Output colors in various formats: HEX, HEX8, RGB(A), HSL(A), HSB(A).
  10. Configure numeric units (px, rem, em, pt) and base font size for rem/em.
  11. Choose your alias strategy: embed resolved values or reference original variables/map keys.
  12. Optionally include collection and mode names in exported variable names.
  13. Include token descriptions as comments in your exported code.
  14. Output JSON color values as strings or structured objects.
  15. Customize CSS mode selector templates (e.g., :root[data-theme="$MODE"]).
  16. See an instant live preview of your export with syntax highlighting.
  17. Download generated token files easily.


Advanced Token Usage Analysis:

  1. Identify which design tokens are actively used in your Figma designs.
  2. Analyze token usage on the "Current Page" or across the "Entire File".
  3. View a "Used" column in the token table for clear visual indicators.
  4. See updated collection counts showing (used / total) tokens after analysis.
  5. View a prominent banner confirming the scope and results of the last analysis.
  6. Filter the token list to show "All," "Used," or "Unused" tokens.


Deep Library Integration (All Features Currently Enabled):

  1. Effortlessly work with variables from your enabled Figma libraries.
  2. See clear indicators for the source library of your collections, including the library name where available.
  3. Includes powerful, deep alias resolution across external libraries – essential for complex design systems, ensuring your exported values are always accurate.
  4. The UI intuitively displays information about library-linked aliases with distinct styling, providing full clarity in your token management.


Get Started with adamantium token lab Today!

Take control of your design tokens, accelerate your development process, and ensure unparalleled consistency across your projects. Install adamantium token lab and transform your Figma Variables workflow!



🌱 This is a Beta Version!

adamantium token lab is currently in active development and is being released as a Beta version. This means that while we've worked hard to make it powerful and stable, you might encounter occasional bugs or quirks.


Your Feedback is Gold! 🪙

We are incredibly passionate about making adamantium token lab the best token management tool for you, and your experience and insights are crucial to this journey. As you use the plugin, please help us improve by:


  1. Reporting any bugs or issues you encounter.
  2. Sharing your feature requests and ideas for new functionality.
  3. Letting us know what you love and what could be even better.


Your feedback will directly shape the future of adamantium token lab, helping us to squash bugs, refine features, and build the ultimate token workflow tool. We're committed to regular updates and improvements based on your input.
plugins.tagline: analyze, organize, name, export, cleanup. One token lab to rule your tokens (figma variables).

plugins.name: Section Auto-Resize with 200px Margin
plugins.description:
This plugin automatically resizes Figma Sections to fit their content and adds a 200px margin around the content area. It's designed to help teams maintain consistent spacing and layout rules without manually adjusting section boundaries.


Perfect for teams working with grid systems, spacing standards, or design system alignment workflows.
plugins.tagline: Auto-resize sections and apply consistent 200px margin padding.

133400.name: Section Auto-Resize with 200px Margin
133400.description:
This plugin automatically resizes Figma Sections to fit their content and adds a 200px margin around the content area. It's designed to help teams maintain consistent spacing and layout rules without manually adjusting section boundaries.


Perfect for teams working with grid systems, spacing standards, or design system alignment workflows.
133400.tagline: Auto-resize sections and apply consistent 200px margin padding.

plugins.name: GPT to Canvas
plugins.description: This plugin helps to plot e.g. tables from chatGPT research on to your Figma or FigJam canvas to be able to overcome chat interface limitations and spatially distribute information quickly especially on lengthy brainstorms. The plugin uses the OpenAI API and requires your personal OpenAI API Key.
plugins.tagline: Plot chatGPT research on canvas

133314.name: GPT to Canvas
133314.description: This plugin helps to plot e.g. tables from chatGPT research on to your Figma or FigJam canvas to be able to overcome chat interface limitations and spatially distribute information quickly especially on lengthy brainstorms. The plugin uses the OpenAI API and requires your personal OpenAI API Key.

plugins.name: 핸드오프러브
plugins.description:
이제, 당신의 핸드오프에도 로맨스가 필요할 때.

나만의 발자님을 위한 사랑스러운 디자이너가 되어보세요



OVERVIEW

디자인 수정을 요청할 때, 핸드오프 문서를 전달할 때, QA를 진행할 때...

디자이너와 발자님과의 관계는 항상 위태롭습니다.

서로의 언어가 달라서 오해가 생길 때,

‘핸드오프러브’로 사랑이 담긴 핸드오프 러브레터를 보내보세요!


HOW IT WORKS

발자님께 전할 내용을 입력하고 발자님의 언어를 선택하기만 하면,

사랑스러운 핸드오프 내용으로 변환되어 내 피그마에 러브레터가 첨부됩니다.


FEATURES


1. 8개 이상의 개발 언어를 연인 스타일로 지원

Python부터 Java, JS, SQL, Go, TypeScript, C++, 그리고 Android 개발자를 위한 Kotlin 언어를 지원하며 각 언어에 특화된 말투와 이미지가 지원됩니다.


2. 사랑이 담긴 고급 프롬프트 패턴 엔진

수개월 간 직접 설계한 각 언어 별 프롬프트 패턴이 적용되어 있으며, 수많은 연애 경험을 살려 고안한 실전 문장으로 변환됩니다.


3. 디자이너 취향저격 러브레터 디자인

문장 입력만으로 사랑가득한 러브레터 카드가 자동 생성되며 텍스트 수정도 가능합니다.


4. 복사 버튼으로 슬랙/노션에 바로 붙여넣기

핸드오프가 메모처럼 가볍고 예뻐지는 순간을 경험해보세요


5. 발자님과의 갈등을 없애는 최적의 팀워크 도구

단순 문장을 사랑스럽게 바꾸는 것을 넘어 실제 개발자들이 디자이너의 말을 오해 없이 받아들이고, 더 나아가 사랑이 시작될지도...


6. “말 때문에 생기는 오해”를 구조적으로 해결

오빠, input()만 해주면 돼. 나머진 이 플러그인이 알아서 해줄 거야.


문의할 내용이 있다면,

doingseo0906@gmail.com으로 언제든지 연락주세요 :>
plugins.tagline: 이제, 당신의 핸드오프에도 로맨스가 필요할 때.

4. 복사 버튼으로 슬랙/노션에 바로 붙여넣기

핸드오프가 메모처럼 가볍고 예뻐지는 순간을 경험해보세요


5. 발자님과의 갈등을 없애는 최적의 팀워크 도구

단순 문장을 사랑스럽게 바꾸는 것을 넘어 실제 개발자들이 디자이너의 말을 오해 없이 받아들이고, 더 나아가 사랑이 시작될지도...


6. “말 때문에 생기는 오해”를 구조적으로 해결

오빠, input()만 해주면 돼. 나머진 이 플러그인이 알아서 해줄 거야.


문의할 내용이 있다면,

doingseo0906@gmail.com으로 언제든지 연락주세요 :>

plugins.name: Motionmill
plugins.description:
Prepare Your Figma File for Development with This Plugin


This Figma plugin helps you set up a well-organized and developer-friendly design file from the start. It allows you to quickly define and document your color palette and typography styles—both as Figma styles and directly within the design file.


By standardizing colors and text styles early in the process, you create a solid foundation for a consistent visual identity and a smoother handoff to development. Developers can easily reference the documented styles and convert them into design tokens or variables in code (e.g., CSS variables or a design system setup). This includes font families, sizes, line heights, and color codes—all clearly named and structured.


This plugin is perfect for teams looking to streamline collaboration between design and development. It saves time, reduces confusion, and ensures consistency throughout the project.
plugins.tagline: Colors and Typography for Motionmill

132803.name: Motionmill
132803.description:
Prepare Your Figma File for Development with This Plugin


This Figma plugin helps you set up a well-organized and developer-friendly design file from the start. It allows you to quickly define and document your color palette and typography styles—both as Figma styles and directly within the design file.


By standardizing colors and text styles early in the process, you create a solid foundation for a consistent visual identity and a smoother handoff to development. Developers can easily reference the documented styles and convert them into design tokens or variables in code (e.g., CSS variables or a design system setup). This includes font families, sizes, line heights, and color codes—all clearly named and structured.


This plugin is perfect for teams looking to streamline collaboration between design and development. It saves time, reduces confusion, and ensures consistency throughout the project.

plugins.name: AI Alt Text Generator
plugins.description:
# Figma Plugin: AI Alt Text Generator


AI Alt Text Generatorは、Figma上で選択した画像に対してGoogle GeminiまたはOpenAIのAIを使い、アクセシブルな代替テキスト（altテキスト）を自動生成するFigmaプラグインです。


---


## 機能概要

- **Gemini（Google）またはOpenAI Vision API**を利用し、画像内容に応じたaltテキストを自動生成

- **日本語・英語のUI/プロンプト切り替え**（画面右上のボタンで即時反映）

- **APIキーはFigmaのclientStorageに安全に保存**

- **複数候補（1～5件）を一度に生成し、編集・選択可能**

- **キーワード指定**で生成内容をカスタマイズ

- **画像プレビュー**とステータス表示

- **エラー時の明確なフィードバック**


---


## セットアップ

1. プラグインをFigmaにインストールします。

2. [Google Gemini APIキー](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) または [OpenAI APIキー](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys) を取得します。

3. プラグインを起動し、設定タブでAPIキーを入力・保存してください。


---


## 使い方

1. **Figmaキャンバス上で画像ノードを選択**

2. 「Altテキスト生成」タブで「画像を解析」ボタンをクリック

3. 画像プレビューとサイズが表示されます

4. 必要に応じてキーワード（日本語は読点「、」区切り、英語はカンマ区切り）や候補数を指定

5. 「代替テキストを生成する」ボタンをクリック

6. 候補リストが表示され、各候補は編集可能

7. 必要に応じて内容をコピーし、プロジェクトの代替テキスト欄等に貼り付けてご利用ください


---


## 言語切り替え

- 画面右上の「日本語 | English」ボタンでUI・プロンプト・説明文が即座に切り替わります。


---


## APIキーについて

- GeminiまたはOpenAIのAPIキーが必要です（どちらか一方でも可。両方入力時はGeminiが優先されます）

- APIキーはFigmaのclientStorageに安全に保存されます

- 無料枠や利用制限については各サービスの公式情報をご確認ください


---


## 注意事項

- このプラグインは選択画像の内容を外部AIサービス（Google Gemini/OpenAI）に送信します。プライバシーや機密情報の取り扱いにご注意ください。

- 生成されるaltテキストはAIによる自動生成のため、最終的な内容はご自身でご確認ください。


---


## English


### Overview

AI Alt Text Generator is a Figma plugin that uses Google Gemini or OpenAI Vision APIs to automatically generate accessible alt text for selected images in your Figma file.


### Features

- Generate alt text using **Gemini (Google) or OpenAI Vision API**

- **UI and prompt language switch (Japanese/English)** with a single button

- **API keys are securely saved** using Figma's clientStorage

- **Generate multiple candidates (1–5) at once, editable and selectable**

- **Keyword input** to influence the generated alt text

- **Image preview** and status display

- **Clear error feedback**


### Setup

1. Install the plugin in Figma

2. Obtain a [Google Gemini API key](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) or an [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

3. Launch the plugin and enter/save your API key(s) in the Settings tab


### How to Use

1. **Select an image node on the Figma canvas**

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "、" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "日本語 | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.
plugins.tagline: AI Alt Text Generatorは、Figma上で選択した画像に対してGoogle GeminiまたはOpenAIのAIを使い、アクセシブルな代替テキスト（altテキスト）を自動生成します。

132361.description:
# Figma Plugin: AI Alt Text Generator


AI Alt Text Generatorは、Figma上で選択した画像に対してGoogle GeminiまたはOpenAIのAIを使い、アクセシブルな代替テキスト（altテキスト）を自動生成するFigmaプラグインです。


---


## 機能概要

- **Gemini（Google）またはOpenAI Vision API**を利用し、画像内容に応じたaltテキストを自動生成

2. [Google Gemini APIキー](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) または [OpenAI APIキー](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys) を取得します。

3. プラグインを起動し、設定タブでAPIキーを入力・保存してください。


---


## 使い方

1. **Figmaキャンバス上で画像ノードを選択**

2. 「Altテキスト生成」タブで「画像を解析」ボタンをクリック

5. 「代替テキストを生成する」ボタンをクリック

7. 必要に応じて内容をコピーし、プロジェクトの代替テキスト欄等に貼り付けてご利用ください


---


## 言語切り替え

- 画面右上の「日本語 | English」ボタンでUI・プロンプト・説明文が即座に切り替わります。


---

- GeminiまたはOpenAIのAPIキーが必要です（どちらか一方でも可。両方入力時はGeminiが優先されます）

- APIキーはFigmaのclientStorageに安全に保存されます

- 無料枠や利用制限については各サービスの公式情報をご確認ください


---


## 注意事項

- このプラグインは選択画像の内容を外部AIサービス（Google Gemini/OpenAI）に送信します。プライバシーや機密情報の取り扱いにご注意ください。

- 生成されるaltテキストはAIによる自動生成のため、最終的な内容はご自身でご確認ください。


---


## English


### Overview

AI Alt Text Generator is a Figma plugin that uses Google Gemini or OpenAI Vision APIs to automatically generate accessible alt text for selected images in your Figma file.


### Features

- Generate alt text using **Gemini (Google) or OpenAI Vision API**

- **UI and prompt language switch (Japanese/English)** with a single button

- **API keys are securely saved** using Figma's clientStorage

- **Generate multiple candidates (1–5) at once, editable and selectable**

- **Keyword input** to influence the generated alt text

- **Image preview** and status display

- **Clear error feedback**


### Setup

1. Install the plugin in Figma

2. Obtain a [Google Gemini API key](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) or an [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

3. Launch the plugin and enter/save your API key(s) in the Settings tab


### How to Use

1. **Select an image node on the Figma canvas**

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "、" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.

plugins.name: Figma 2 FRIDA
plugins.description: Users can select Figma frames to automatically generate clean, functional code for Flutter, React, Kotlin and Angular, with the code adapting to the specific data within the frames. This includes not only the UI components but also layout structures and other relevant data. Additionally, the tool provides the ability to generate automated test cases based on the generated code, helping ensure quality and functionality. For app deployment, users can generate the necessary icon files tailored for various platforms, simplifying the process for app deployment across different app stores and environments.
plugins.tagline: Generate code for both mobile and web based on Figma UI designs.

131649.name: Figma 2 FRIDA
131649.description: Users can select Figma frames to automatically generate clean, functional code for Flutter, React, Kotlin and Angular, with the code adapting to the specific data within the frames. This includes not only the UI components but also layout structures and other relevant data. Additionally, the tool provides the ability to generate automated test cases based on the generated code, helping ensure quality and functionality. For app deployment, users can generate the necessary icon files tailored for various platforms, simplifying the process for app deployment across different app stores and environments.

networkAccess.reasoning: To access Firebase services and external APIs

131649.tagline: Generate code for both mobile and web based on Figma UI designs.

plugins.name: Sustainalyzer
plugins.description:
Sustainalyzer helps you evaluate the ecological impact of your Figma designs. It detects design elements that conflict with the Web Sustainability Guidelines (WSG) and scientific research on digital sustainability.


The plugin checks for the following sustainability issues:


  1. Avoid videos, particularly autoplay or background media
  2. Minimize image use, especially large or excessive images
  3. Optimize images for size, format, and scaling
  4. Avoid third-party services (e.g. embeds, maps, social widgets)
  5. Avoid decorative elements that add visual weight without purpose
  6. Limit font variants to reduce font file size
  7. Prefer system fonts over custom fonts
  8. Reduce complexity by limiting the number of elements
  9. Disable animation autoplay to reduce processor load
  10. Consider older devices, avoiding effects that degrade performance or compatibility
  11. Use a design system to support reuse and reduce redundancy
  12. Choose energy-efficient colors, especially for large UI areas


Each guideline is tagged with an impact level—high, medium, or low—indicating its potential contribution to emissions. You can filter the results by impact level to focus on the most critical issues.


To use Sustainalyzer, simply select the elements you want to analyze and run the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Check your designs for sustainability issues based on the Web Sustainability Guidelines.

133118.release_notes:
- Removed Linear & Radial gradient from decorative elements check
- Minor bug fixes
133118.tagline: Check your designs for sustainability issues based on the Web Sustainability Guidelines.

plugins.name: Add Section
plugins.description:
Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

  1. Select elements (frames, rectangles, even other sections)
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Add section to put a new section around your selected elements


Resize existing sections to have the correct padding

  1. Select one or more sections
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Resize Sections to adjust all selected sections
plugins.tagline: Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

131159.name: Add Section
131159.description:
Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

  1. Select elements (frames, rectangles, even other sections)
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Add section to put a new section around your selected elements


Resize existing sections to have the correct padding

  1. Select one or more sections
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Resize Sections to adjust all selected sections
131159.release_notes:
- Added a way to fix the padding on existing sections (Resize Sections button)
- Fixed a bug where the plugin closed after each use
- Improved performance
131159.tagline: Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

plugins.name: 앱스토어 리뷰 추출기 (Appstpre Review Extractor)
plugins.description:
🧩 애플 앱스토어 리뷰를 Figma 프레임에 손쉽게 가져와 정리하세요

Easily import and organize Apple App Store reviews into your Figma frames


이 플러그인은 Apple App Store의 앱 리뷰를 가져와 평점별로 정리해줍니다.

사용자 피드백 분석, 제품 개선 준비, 인사이트 시각화 등 다양한 상황에서

실사용자 의견을 Figma 안에서 빠르고 효율적으로 표현할 수 있습니다.

→ This plugin fetches app reviews from the Apple App Store and organizes them by rating.

It's perfect for analyzing user feedback, planning improvements, and visualizing insights—all within Figma.


🔍 주요 기능 | Key Features

최근 평점별(5★, 4★ 등) 리뷰 가져오기 가능

→ Import recent reviews by rating (e.g., 5★, 4★)


현재 운영 중인 앱의 현황 확인, 고객의 pain point 확인

→ Check the current status of your app and identify user pain points


UX 리서치, 앱 디자인, 제품 문서화에 활용 가능

→ Use in UX research, app design, and product documentation


🛠 사용순서 | How to Use

1) 플러그인을 실행하세요

→ Launch the plugin


2) 사용하고자 하는 앱스토어 ID를 확인합니다

→ Find the App Store ID of your target app

(https://www.apple.com/kr/app-store/에서 앱 검색 후 주소창에 id숫자 확인/복사)

→ (Search the app on the App Store and copy the numeric id from the URL)


3) 해당 ID를 플러그인 입력창에 붙여넣습니다

→ Paste the ID into the plugin input field


4) 원하는 평점(예: 5★) 을 선택합니다

→ Select the desired rating (e.g., 5★)


5) "리뷰 불러오기" 버튼을 클릭합니다

→ Click the "Import Reviews" button

accepted.name: kenny
accepted.description: I am a designer who creates the tools and experiences that users truly need. I believe good design goes beyond visuals, flow and development.

plugins.tagline: App Store 리뷰를 한눈에, 피그마로 정리하자 (in Figma, Check your app review)

plugins.name: LocalizeBuddy
plugins.description:
🌏 Introducing LocalizeBuddy for Figma — Your Ultimate i18n Export Companion!


LocalizeBuddy automatically extracts every text layer from your Figma file and converts it into clean, structured JSON—perfectly formatted for any localization pipeline. Skip the tedious copy-and-paste: design and ship faster with truly seamless internationalization. ✨


Standout Features:


🔍 Comprehensive Text Discovery

Auto-detects every text node, even deep inside groups, components, and nested frames.


🔑 Smart Key Mapping

Auto-generate consistent, position-based keys that mirror your design hierarchy—e.g. page1.frame2.text3—so every JSON entry is predictably unique without relying on layer-name transformations.


📂 Structured JSON Output

Preserve your art-board and frame hierarchy in the output to keep context clear for translators.


🖼️ Frame-Only Export

Export the selected frame in one click—ideal for precise, frame-level JSON extraction.

accepted.name: Alvin Bellero
accepted.description: Crafting code and building dreams, one line at a time 👨🏻‍💻🤞🚀

plugins.tagline: Effortless export Figma text layers as structured JSON in one click—instantly accelerate i18n setup!

Standout Features:

🔑 Smart Key Mapping

Auto-generate consistent, position-based keys that mirror your design hierarchy—e.g. page1.frame2.text3—so every JSON entry is predictably unique without relying on layer-name transformations.


📂 Structured JSON Output

🖼️ Frame-Only Export

133498.release_notes:
- Now supports `Section` Node text extraction
- Replace `Export to CSV` with `Export to Excel`
133498.tagline: Effortless export Figma text layers as structured JSON in one click—instantly accelerate i18n setup!

plugins.name: CTRLFRK:GRAD
plugins.description:
GRAD gives you unprecedented control over colour transitions through the power of Bezier curves. This sophisticated plugin brings laboratory-grade precision to your gradient work through highly-customisable curves. Manipulate how colours blend across HSB components, visualise transitions in real-time, and achieve interpolation paths that were previously impossible. Perfect for brand work, illustrations, and UI design where colour transitions matter.


  1. Create expressive colour gradients with precise Bezier curve control
  2. Independently manipulate hue, saturation, and brightness curves for nuanced transitions
  3. Apply preset curves (ease-in, ease-out, S-curves) for common gradient effects
  4. Visualise and fine-tune with an interactive interface
  5. Generate exact colour stops based on mathematical interpolation
  6. Apply gradients directly to selected objects or create new gradient rectangles
plugins.tagline: Precision gradient control for the colour obsessed

132857.name: CTRLFRK:GRAD
132857.description:
GRAD gives you unprecedented control over colour transitions through the power of Bezier curves. This sophisticated plugin brings laboratory-grade precision to your gradient work through highly-customisable curves. Manipulate how colours blend across HSB components, visualise transitions in real-time, and achieve interpolation paths that were previously impossible. Perfect for brand work, illustrations, and UI design where colour transitions matter.


  1. Create expressive colour gradients with precise Bezier curve control
  2. Independently manipulate hue, saturation, and brightness curves for nuanced transitions
  3. Apply preset curves (ease-in, ease-out, S-curves) for common gradient effects
  4. Visualise and fine-tune with an interactive interface
  5. Generate exact colour stops based on mathematical interpolation
  6. Apply gradients directly to selected objects or create new gradient rectangles
132857.release_notes: This update delivers key under-the-hood improvements for a more stable and reliable GRAD experience.
132857.tagline: Precision gradient control for the colour obsessed

plugins.name: Accessibility Compliance
plugins.description:

plugins.name: Quanta Symphony Design Review
plugins.description:
The Automated Design Review Checklist ensures that UI/UX designs maintain high standards of organization, accessibility, layout, and content quality. It systematically evaluates design files to identify potential issues and improve usability.


In terms of Layer Organization, it checks for clear and descriptive layer names, flagging defaults like “Rectangle 1,” “Text 1,” “Frame,” or “Group.” It also detects hidden layers, ensures layers used as masks are correctly applied, and verifies the presence of effects to maintain design consistency.


For Accessibility, the checklist validates text contrast ratios against WCAG 2.1 standards to ensure readability:

•Regular text (< 18px) must have a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1.

•Large text (≥ 18px or ≥ 14px bold) should meet a minimum contrast ratio of 3:1.

It also warns if text size is below 14px, flags elements smaller than 24x24px (as they might be too small for touch targets), and checks for opacity settings that could impact visibility.


The Layout Review identifies problematic scale constraints that could cause resizing issues and evaluates layer dimensions to ensure usability across different screen sizes.


In terms of Content, the system detects empty text layers that may indicate missing information and checks text properties to maintain proper styling, readability, and hierarchy.


By automating these design checks, this system helps designers streamline their workflow, ensuring consistency, accessibility, and overall design quality before final delivery.
plugins.tagline: Automate. Validate. Elevate.

127028.name: Quanta Symphony Design Review
127028.description:
The Automated Design Review Checklist ensures that UI/UX designs maintain high standards of organization, accessibility, layout, and content quality. It systematically evaluates design files to identify potential issues and improve usability.


In terms of Layer Organization, it checks for clear and descriptive layer names, flagging defaults like “Rectangle 1,” “Text 1,” “Frame,” or “Group.” It also detects hidden layers, ensures layers used as masks are correctly applied, and verifies the presence of effects to maintain design consistency.


For Accessibility, the checklist validates text contrast ratios against WCAG 2.1 standards to ensure readability:

•Regular text (< 18px) must have a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1.

•Large text (≥ 18px or ≥ 14px bold) should meet a minimum contrast ratio of 3:1.

It also warns if text size is below 14px, flags elements smaller than 24x24px (as they might be too small for touch targets), and checks for opacity settings that could impact visibility.


The Layout Review identifies problematic scale constraints that could cause resizing issues and evaluates layer dimensions to ensure usability across different screen sizes.


In terms of Content, the system detects empty text layers that may indicate missing information and checks text properties to maintain proper styling, readability, and hierarchy.


By automating these design checks, this system helps designers streamline their workflow, ensuring consistency, accessibility, and overall design quality before final delivery.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin needs to access external resources for WCAG contrast checking and design pattern validation.

plugins.name: Outset Pr Invoice Plugin
plugins.description:
Invoice Filler Plugin for Outset PR


This plugin is specifically designed for Outset PR and works exclusively with their internal invoice template in Figma. It automates the process of populating the template with data submitted via the plugin’s form, streamlining the invoicing workflow for the company.


How It Works:


The plugin is built to integrate with a single invoice template used by Outset PR.

Users submit invoice data through the plugin's form.

The plugin then automatically fills the predefined fields in the Outset PR invoice template within Figma.


Limitation for Reviewers:


Since the plugin is tailored for Outset PR's proprietary invoice template, reviewers will not have access to the template for testing.


For Figma Reviewers:


To review the functionality of the plugin, please use mock data in the form. The plugin will generate a dummy page with the entered data displayed.

If you are a member of the Figma team, please fill out the form and review the data generated by the plugin to understand its intended functionality.


Key Features:


Specifically designed for Outset PR’s invoice template, allowing users to quickly populate the template with the required data.

Simplifies the invoicing process for Outset PR by eliminating manual data entry.

Optimized for seamless integration with a single internal template used by the company.
plugins.tagline: A plugin to fill invoices

plugins.name: Diopter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you see how you are using remote components for linked and unlinked libraries. For example, you can find mobile components in a file with only desktop explorations. With a tool like this, you can being spring cleaning now and get your files squeaky clean.


To use this plugin, you'll need to create a personal access token with read-only access to files. I needed that token to be able to get details about file libraries—e.g., library name. The first time you run the plugin, you'll be asked to paste the token.
plugins.tagline: Clearly see which components you're using and where they come from.

127509.name: Diopter
127509.description:

To use this plugin, you'll need to create a personal access token with read-only access to files. I needed that token to be able to get details about file libraries—e.g., library name. The first time you run the plugin, you'll be asked to paste the token.
127509.release_notes: Adds a way to find frames that used to be components.
127509.tagline: Clearly see which components you're using and where they come from.

plugins.name: QD - Magix - AI Text Generator
plugins.description:
Magix - AI Text Generator enables seamless text creation for your designs using OpenAI’s API.


After connecting the API, simply select the text elements (Text objects, Sticky notes or Shapes with text) you wish to generate. The plugin will automatically list them, allowing you to input custom prompts. With a single click on ‘Generate Content’ all selected text elements will be instantly generated and integrated into your design, streamlining your workflow.


AI Makes It Simple...
plugins.tagline: AI-Powered Text Generation - All Texts with One Click

122756.name: QD - Magix - AI Text Generator
122756.description:
Magix - AI Text Generator enables seamless text creation for your designs using OpenAI’s API.


After connecting the API, simply select the text elements (Text objects, Sticky notes or Shapes with text) you wish to generate. The plugin will automatically list them, allowing you to input custom prompts. With a single click on ‘Generate Content’ all selected text elements will be instantly generated and integrated into your design, streamlining your workflow.


AI Makes It Simple...

I’m constantly working to improve Magix for a better experience. If you have any suggestions or encounter any issues, feel free to share them! 😊

Version 3 Release Notes:
•  Improved UI and UX for a smoother experience
•  Fixed plugin issues in FigJam
•  Added text generation support for sticky notes and text-based shapes
•  Enhanced state message display
•  Resolved reported bugs

plugins.name: Scribe Guard - AI-powered Writing System Validator
plugins.description:
🎯 What is it?

A powerful AI tool that analyzes your text content against your writing system guidelines, ensuring perfect brand consistency and tone of voice alignment.


✨ Key Features

  1. AI-powered content analysis
  2. Writing system validation
  3. Style guide compliance checks
  4. Tone of voice verification
  5. Terminology consistency
  6. Real-time feedback


🚀 How to Use

  1. Upload your Writing System PDF
  2. Enter your ChatGPT API key
  3. Click "Analyze Copy"
  4. Review the detailed analysis


🛠️ What You'll Need

  1. ChatGPT API key
  2. Your writing system guidelines in PDF


🔒 Security Note

Your API key is handled securely and can be saved locally for convenience. All communications are encrypted and only happen through authorized channels.



The tool provides detailed feedback on tone, terminology, and style compliance, helping you maintain perfect brand consistency across all your content. No more manual checking - let AI do the heavy lifting! ✨
plugins.tagline: Validate your text content against writing system guidelines with AI-powered analysis

plugins.name: Template Manager
plugins.description:
Figma Template Saver


Description:

Effortlessly save and reuse entire Figma designs as templates while preserving frames, text, vectors, components, and precise positioning. This plugin ensures that every detail—fills, strokes, corner radius, and vector data—is accurately stored and replicated when applied to new files.


🔹 **Save any selection as a reusable template**

🔹 **Apply templates across different files with full fidelity**

🔹 **Preserve component instances, nested frames, vectors, and typography**

🔹 **Avoid missing fills or strokes with advanced capture logic**


Streamline your workflow and bring consistency to your designs—save once, apply anywhere! 🚀
plugins.tagline: **"Effortlessly save, reuse, and replicate Figma designs—preserve every detail with precision."**

plugins.name: Recount
plugins.description:
Recount replaces text layers with a counter, starting from any number, based on the XY position of each selected layer.


How to use:

  1. select the layers to be counted
  2. run Recount
  3. enter a number to start from (or hit ENTER to choose 1)
  4. choose a direction to count along (or hit ENTER to use LTR)


Left-to-right and right-to-left directions are available.
plugins.tagline: Easily count layers by their position

117829.name: Recount
117829.description:

  2. run Recount

plugins.name: K Translation
plugins.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
plugins.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

103740.name: K Translation
103740.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
103740.release_notes: Added the ability to download a file containing texts that were not translated.
103740.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.
